perturbation.original_text:
SECTION 2.0 TERM

      This Attachment and its Product Attachments shall become effective on the       Effective Date and shall continue for a period of three (3) years unless       terminated as provided in Section 5.0 of the Base Agreement. This       Attachment will automatically be renewed for periods of six (6) months       unless either party gives twelve (12) months written notice of its intent       to terminate this Agreement. Such renewals shall continue for successive       periods under the same terms and conditions, unless otherwise agreed in       writing by both Parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
SECTION 2.0 TERM

      This Attachment and its Product Attachments shall become effective on the       Effective Date and shall continue for a period of three (3) years unless       terminated as provided in Section 5.0 of the Base Agreement. This       Attachment will automatically be renewed for periods of twelve (12) months       unless either party gives six (6) months written notice of its intent       to terminate this Agreement. Such renewals shall continue for successive       periods under the same terms and conditions, unless otherwise agreed in       writing by both Parties.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by presenting conflicting renewal terms. The original states a six-month renewal period with twelve months' notice, while the modified version specifies a twelve-month renewal period with six months' notice. This contradiction would create uncertainty regarding the actual term of the agreement after the initial three years and the required notice period for termination.

perturbation.original_text:
13.1  Consigned Products

      a)    MSL acknowledges that it will manage inventory consigned to MSL by             IBM. As it relates to Integration, MSL will manage not only IBM             consigned inventory but also inventory consigned to MSL by IBM's             customers.

      b)    MSL will be [*]% for inventory accuracy within the logistics             systems and related financial liability for all consigned             Products under MSL's control. MSL will be responsible for all lost,             damaged, or destroyed Parts. MSL will provide replacement value             insurance coverage for consigned Products. IBM will be named as a             joint insured with respect to consigned Products for its interest.             IBM shall have the right at all reasonable times to audit and             inspect the consigned Products. MSL will take no actions that             might encumber IBM's consigned Products.
perturbation.changed_text:
13.1  Consigned Products

      a)    MSL acknowledges that it will manage inventory consigned to MSL by             IBM. As it relates to Integration, MSL will manage not only IBM             consigned inventory but also inventory consigned to MSL by IBM's             customers.

      b)    MSL will be 100% responsible for inventory accuracy within the logistics             systems and related financial liability for all consigned             Products under MSL's control. MSL will not be responsible for any lost,             damaged, or destroyed Parts. MSL will not provide replacement value             insurance coverage for consigned Products. IBM will be solely responsible to be insured with respect to consigned Products for its interest.             IBM shall have the right at all reasonable times to audit and             inspect the consigned Products. MSL will take no actions that             might encumber IBM's consigned Products.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces conflicting statements about MSL's responsibility for consigned products. Initially, MSL has inventory accuracy and is responsible for damaged parts/insurance. The modified section states that MSL is NOT responsible for damaged parts/insurance. This contradiction would lead to disputes over liability and insurance coverage for consigned products.

perturbation.original_text:
14.11 Delivery

      MSL will maintain [*] percent ([*]%) on time delivery, measured against       the CRAD date in the integration roll out schedule. Due to the nature of       the integration orders, there is no [*] option, unless agreed to prior to       shipment by the IBM project manager and/or the customer.
perturbation.changed_text:
14.11 Delivery

      MSL will not maintain any percentage on time delivery, measured against       the CRAD date in the integration roll out schedule. Due to the nature of       the integration orders, there is also [*] option, unless agreed to prior to       shipment by the IBM project manager and/or the customer.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces conflicting requirements regarding delivery performance. It creates uncertainty about whether MSL has any on-time delivery obligations for integration orders, as the modified version explicitly contradicts the commitment to maintain a specific delivery percentage. The parties will not have clear obligations.
